description: The multilateral team will continue the work of a disbanded U.N. panel of experts who were responsible for monitoring the enforcement of the sanctions.

description: The British singer-songwriter rose to fame on the 'X Factor' and was a member of one of the best-selling boy bands of all time.

description: The fact that inflation fell to 1.6 percent in September came as good news amid the affordability crisis, but there are several price levels that remain elevated. On Oct. 15, a Statistics Canada report showed that the latest inflation numbers were the consumer price index’s smallest year-over-year increase since February 2021. The Bank of Canada’s inflation […]
title: While Overall Inflation Is 1.6 Percent, These Items Still Remain Above 2 Percent Benchmark

description: U.S. officials warned, in an Oct. 13 letter, that U.S. support for Israel could be implicated if humanitarian conditions don't improve in the Gaza Strip.

description: A look into the world through the lens of photography.

description: Russian defense minister's meetings with top Chinese general and officials in Beijing, days ahead of an expected visit by China's leader Xi Jinping to Russia.

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau told the Foreign Interference Commission he knows the names of Conservative parliamentarians who are engaged in foreign meddling, and faulted Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre for not getting a security clearance to learn those names. Under questioning by counsel for the Conservatives, Trudeau added that he’s also aware of Liberal lawmakers, as […]
title: At Inquiry, Trudeau Singles Out Tory Lawmakers for Foreign Interference Involvement

description: A female visitor to Vancouver suffered injuries after a suspect with previous assault charges repeatedly punched her and kicked her in the face on the morning of Oct. 13. The 35-year-old victim was walking near the cruise ship terminal at Canada Place in downtown Vancouver just before 9 a.m. when a man suddenly assaulted her, […]
title: Female Tourist Beaten by Previous Offender in Vancouver Stranger Attack

description: 'This military pressure operation is irresponsible, disproportionate, and destabilizing,' the Pentagon said.

description: Despite the rapid growth of renewable energy, fossil fuels will dominate the global energy mix through midcentury, the International Energy Agency says.

description: The Conservative Party of B.C. has released its costed platform just days before the election, saying its plan will see a balanced budget within two terms. Party leader John Rustad introduced the platform costs at a press conference at the University of British Columbia campus on Oct. 15. “I’m not going to be coming in […]
title: BC Conservatives Release Platform Price Tag, Promising Balanced Budget

description: The Prime Minister’s Office blocked former Liberal MP Han Dong from sitting on the Commons Canada-China committee in 2019 after intelligence officials raised concerns about his actions, a senior official testified at the foreign interference inquiry. Brian Clow, deputy chief of staff to the prime minister, told the Foreign Interference Commission that around December 2019, […]
title: Trudeau’s Office Blocked Han Dong’s Appointment to Commons Committee on China After Intelligence Briefing, Inquiry Told

description: More than six billion litres of milk has been discarded on Canadian dairy farms since 2012, according to a newly released study. “Systemic inefficiencies” in Canada’s supply management system have led to between 6.8 billion and 10 billion litres of milk being dumped out over the past 12 years, says the study published in the journal […]
title: Billions of Litres of Canadian Milk Were Dumped in Past 12 Years, Study Suggests

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has called for more Western military support as part of a 'victory plan' to end the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war.
title: Biden Announces $425 Million Arms Package for Ukraine in Call With Zelenskyy

description: Canada’s economic productivity crisis can only be solved if the federal and provincial governments come together to address issues like major project approvals and inter-provincial trade barriers, Alberta’s premier said Wednesday. Danielle Smith made the remarks in Calgary at a national conference on productivity, a term which describes how much an economy produces per hour […]
title: Feds, Provinces Must Work Together to Tackle Productivity Crisis: Alberta Premier

description: A supermoon rises over Rio De Janeiro at 3:50 p.m. ET on Oct. 16.
title: Supermoon Rises Over Rio

description: The Canada Revenue Agency says it has terminated 330 employees for inappropriately receiving the Canada Emergency Response Benefit during the pandemic, giving its final update on an internal review. The CRA launched an internal review in June 2023 into employees who received CERB despite being ineligible for the benefit, which identified 600 employees for further […]
title: Canada Revenue Agency Fires 330 Employees Over CERB Claims During Pandemic

description: Li Qiang visited Pakistan amid recent terrorist attacks including a suicide attack by the Baloch Liberation Army targeting Chinese workers.

description: Immigration Minister Marc Miller says Palestinians who have fled Gaza will receive transitional financial assistance and supports after they arrive in Canada. The Immigration Department says the funds will help cover basic needs, such as shelter, food and clothing, with more details to be shared at a later date. The government will also offer temporary […]
title: Palestinians Who Fled Gaza to Receive Transitional Financial Assistance From Ottawa

description: Canada’s border guards have recovered more stolen vehicles at railyards and ports so far this year than in all of 2023. Transport Minister Anita Anand says the Canada Border Services Agency has recovered 1,945 stolen vehicles, with the majority found in Quebec. The federal government launched an action plan earlier this year to address the […]
title: Border Agency Recovered Nearly 2,000 Stolen Vehicles This Year: Transport Minister

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau defended his top security advisers for not providing him at the time with encompassing reports on Beijing’s interference, saying he didn’t learn anything substantial after reading them. “There are some interesting factoids or tidbits in there that I said, ‘Oh, okay, that’s interesting,'” Trudeau testified at the Foreign Interference Commission on […]

description: National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said the United States and allies support Moldovan efforts to retain democratic integrity.

description: TORONTO—A homeless man refusing long-term care, a woman with severe obesity, an injured worker given meager government assistance, and grieving new widows. All of them requested to be killed under Canada’s euthanasia system, and each sparked private debate among doctors and nurses struggling with the ethics of one of the world’s most permissive laws on […]

description: Report comes after government announces new trial in conjunction with Mounjaro manufacturer Eli Lilly to offer weight-loss jabs to unemployed obese people.

description: Vehicles that do not meet specific emissions standards and are driven within the ULEZ must pay a daily charge of £12.50 or face a £180 penalty.

description: More than three million Ontarians will be living with serious illnesses by 2040, posing significant risk to the already overburdened health-care system in the province, a new report is forecasting. The ever-rising incidence of illness is primarily linked to the province’s aging population as baby boomers enter their 70s and 80s, but a growing number […]
title: 3 Million Ontarians Will Live With Major Illnesses by 2040, Report Predicts

description: The bill to remove hereditary peers passed its second reading, but some Tories are calling for the removal of the Lords Spiritual in an unexpected move.

description: Montreal police say they’ve made an arrest after a man was fatally stabbed on the platform of a downtown metro station late Saturday. title: Montreal Police Make Arrest in Fatal Stabbing on Downtown Subway Platform

description: The Government of Alberta has launched a national advertising campaign dubbed “Scrap the Cap” to oppose Ottawa’s carbon emissions limits on the oil and gas industry. The $7 million campaign will include TV ads, social media posts, print advertisements, and videos. The province rolled out a Scrap the Cap website with the ad campaign on […]
title: Alberta Launches Ad Campaign to Oppose Federal Emissions Caps on Oil and Gas Sector

description: Statistics Canada says the level of food insecurity increased in 2022 as inflation hit peak levels. In a report using data from the Canadian community health survey, the agency says 15.6 percent of households experienced some level of food insecurity in 2022 after being relatively stable from 2017 to 2021. title: Statistics Canada Says Levels of Food Insecurity Rose in 2022

description: Georgia’s ruling party—along with Moscow—accused the West of ‘gross interference’ in the South Caucasus country’s domestic affairs.

description: Public Safety Minister Dominic LeBlanc has rejected a proposal to disclose the names of MPs who allegedly colluded with foreign states, telling the Foreign Interference Commission the issue has been exaggerated. “It is a gross partisan exaggeration, and I think irresponsible for people to—and many have in the public domain—claim that there are traitors sitting […]

description: Campaigners attribute the spike in deaths to a lack of affordable housing, inadequate mental health services, and issues with substance misuse.

description: Ontario House Speaker and longtime Conservative MPP Ted Arnott has announced he will not run in the next provincial election. The Wellington-Halton Hills MPP said his current term will be his last, closing a chapter on a political career that has spanned more than three decades. “To everything there is a season,” he wrote in […]
title: Ontario Speaker Says He Will Not Seek Reelection on Next Provincial Ballot

description: VATICAN CITY—The Vatican Museums unveiled on Tuesday a restoration of one of the crown jewels of their collection, a 2nd century marble sculpture of the Greek god Apollo that has inspired generations of artists and poets. Restoration experts spent years working on the “Apollo Belvedere,” repairing fractures in its knees and legs, cleaning the entire […]
title: Vatican Unveils Restored ‘Apollo Belvedere,’ Roman Marble Masterpiece

description: The British government says India should co-operate with Canada’s investigation into accusations that its government has been involved in an escalating number of violent crimes in Canada. description: More than 200 Air India passengers should be on the ground in Chicago this morning after their flight was diverted to Nunavut due to a bomb threat. description: CAIRO—Egypt opened a series of galleries to the public on Tuesday in its flagship new museum, but the glittering King Tutankhamun collection and solar boats buried by the Pyramid of Khufu are yet to be unveiled, pending a long-delayed grand inauguration. More than 20 years under construction, the sprawling Grand Egyptian Museum (GEM) next to […]

description: The vast majority of ethnic and indigenous British Columbians reject the notion that drug criminalization is racist. description: New treatment protocol gave a short course of chemotherapy before chemoradiation, with long-term study showing promising improvement in survival chances.

description: With Canada’s inflation rate falling to 1.6 percent in September, lower than the Bank of Canada’s target of 2 percent, there are increasing expectations that steeper interest rate cuts could be likely.
